title: Moroccan harira soup with chicken

ingredients.content: 10 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, plus extra for garnishing
120 g leeks (white part only), cut into pieces
100 g celery stalks, cut into pieces
30 g olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
600 g tomatoes, cut into pieces (2 cm - see Tips)
4 skinless chicken thigh fillets (approx. 400 g), cut into pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Place coriander into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place leeks, celery and carrot into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, cumin, ground coriander, cinnamon, turmeric and harissa and cook <b>4 min/100°C//speed <b>.
Add water, tomatoes, lentils, stock paste, sugar and reserved coriander and cook <b>20 min/100°C//speed 1<b>, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Add lemon juice and chicken and cook <b>15 min/100°C//speed <b>, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
To serve, divide between serving bowls, drizzle with oil, garnish with extra coriander leaves and top with spoonfuls of yoghurt. Serve with toast on the side.

hintsAndTricks: <b>Vegetarian harira soup<b>: omit the chicken and proceed as per recipe.
Harissa is a spicy paste made using hot red chillies, and often used in African dishes. You can find harissa at specialty food stores, some major supermarkets (in the international aisle) or online.
The cooking time for dried green lentils may vary; adjust cooking time accordingly.
You can use tinned tomatoes for this recipe, if you prefer.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
